turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about Netherlands.
turn.1: What is the difference between a minister and a minister without portfolio?
turn.2: One to three ministers are ministers without portfolio.
turn.3: Who is the head of the cabinet?
turn.4: The head of government is the Prime Minister of the Netherlands, who often is the leader of the largest party of the coalition.
turn.5: Does the head of the cabinet have more power?
turn.6: The Prime Minister is a "primus inter pares", with no explicit powers beyond those of the other ministers.
turn.8: Mark Rutte has been Prime Minister since October 2010; the Prime Minister had been the leader of the largest party continuously since 1973.
turn.9: Is the cabinet responsible to anyone?
turn.10: The cabinet is responsible to the bicameral parliament, the States General, which also has legislative powers.
turn.11: How are the members of the cabinet elected?
turn.12: The 150 members of the House of Representatives, the lower house, are elected in direct elections on the basis of party-list proportional representation.
